$eref.description: Disk resource properties.

___encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

___creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

___accountType.description: the storage account type of the disk.

___diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

$eref.description: Describes the properties of an Image.

___sourceVirtualMachine.description: The source virtual machine from which Image is created.

$eref.description: Disk resource properties.

___encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

___creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

___accountType.description: the storage account type of the disk.

___diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

$eref.description: Plan for the resource.

___plan.description: The purchase plan when deploying a virtual machine scale set from VM Marketplace images.

$eref.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Scale Set.

___overprovision.description: Specifies whether the Virtual Machine Scale Set should be overprovisioned.

___singlePlacementGroup.description: When true this limits the scale set to a single placement group, of max size 100 virtual machines.

$eref.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set sku.

___sku.description: The virtual machine scale set sku.

$eref.description: The instance view of a resource.

___virtualMachines.description: A list of references to all virtual machines in the availability set.

___managed.description: If the availability set supports managed disks.

Plan for the resource.

___plan.description: The purchase plan when deploying virtual machine from VM Marketplace images.

$eref.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine.

___licenseType.description: Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises. This element is only used for images that contain the Windows Server operating system.

___availabilitySet.description: The reference Id of the availability set to which the virtual machine belongs.

_88VirtualMachineScaleSetStorageProfile.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set storage profile.

$eref.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set operating system disk.

___image.description: The Source User Image VirtualHardDisk. This VirtualHardDisk will be copied before using it to attach to the Virtual Machine. If SourceImage is provided, the destination VirtualHardDisk should not exist.

___vhdContainers.description: The list of virtual hard disk container uris.

$eref.description: The image reference.

___version.description: The image version. The allowed formats are Major.Minor.Build or 'latest'. Major, Minor and Build are decimal numbers. Specify 'latest' to use the latest version of the image.

$eref.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of KeK, KeK is optional and when provided is used to unwrap the encryptionKey

___keyUrl.description: Url pointing to a key or secret in KeyVault

___sourceVault.description: Resource id of the KeyVault containing the key or secret

___keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

___enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

$eref.description: Describes Boot Diagnostics.

___storageUri.description: URI of the storage account to use for placing the console output and screenshot.

___enabled.description: Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine.

___bootDiagnostics.description: Boot Diagnostics is a debugging feature which allows the user to view console output and/or a screenshot of the virtual machine from the hypervisor.

_88SshPublicKey.description: Contains information about SSH certificate public key and the path on the Linux VM where the public key is placed.

___keyData.description: Certificate public key used to authenticate to the VM through SSH. The certificate must be in Pem format with or without headers.

___path.description: Specifies the full path on the created VM where SSH public key is stored. If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file.

___version.description: The image version. The allowed formats are Major.Minor.Build or 'latest'. Major, Minor and Build are decimal numbers. Specify 'latest' to use the latest version of the image.

___diskSizeGB.description: The initial disk size, in GB, for blank data disks, and the new desired size for resizing existing OS and data disks.

_88VaultSecretGroup.description: Describes a set of certificates which are all in the same Key Vault.

$eref.description: Describes a single certificate reference in a Key Vault, and where the certificate should reside on the VM.

___certificateStore.description: The Certificate store in LocalMachine to add the certificate to on Windows, leave empty on Linux.

___certificateUrl.description: The URL referencing a secret in a Key Vault which contains a properly formatted certificate.

___vaultCertificates.description: The list of key vault references in SourceVault which contain certificates.

___sourceVault.description: The Relative URL of the Key Vault containing all of the certificates in VaultCertificates.

___sourceVault.description: The Relative URL of the Key Vault containing all of the certificates in VaultCertificates.

___secrets.description: The list of certificates for addition to the VM.

___customData.description: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data. The base-64 encoded string is decoded to a binary array that is saved as a file on the Virtual Machine. The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes

$eref.description: Describes Windows Configuration of the OS Profile.

___winRM.description: The Windows Remote Management configuration of the VM

___additionalUnattendContent.description: Additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file.

___enableAutomaticUpdates.description: Indicates whether Windows updates are automatically installed on the VM.

___provisionVMAgent.description: Indicates whether the virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the Virtual Machine. If not specified, then the default behavior is to set it to true.

___timeZone.description: The time zone of the VM

___windowsConfiguration.description: The Windows configuration of the OS profile.

___adminUsername.description: Specifies the name of the administrator account.

___computerName.description: Specifies the host OS name of the virtual machine.

___adminPassword.description: Specifies the password of the administrator account.

_88CreationData.description: Data used when creating a disk.

___sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk. If creationOption is Restore, this is the ARM-like id of the source disk restore point.

___storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

$eref.description: The source image used for creating the disk.

___lun.description: If the disk is created from an image's data disk, this is an index that indicates which of the data disks in the image to use. For OS disks, this field is null.

___id.description: A relative uri containing either a Platform Imgage Repository or user image reference.

___sourceUri.description: If creationOption is Import, this is a SAS URI to a blob to be imported into a managed disk. If creationOption is Copy, this is a relative Uri containing the id of the source snapshot to be copied into a managed disk.

$eref.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

___diskEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Secret Url and vault id of the disk encryption key

___keyEncryptionKey.description: Key Vault Key Url and vault id of the key encryption key

___enabled.description: Set this flag to true and provide DiskEncryptionKey and optional KeyEncryptionKey to enable encryption. Set this flag to false and remove DiskEncryptionKey and KeyEncryptionKey to disable encryption. If EncryptionSettings is null in the request object, the existing settings remain unchanged.

___encryptionSettings.description: Encryption settings for disk or snapshot

$eref.description: Data used when creating a disk.

___sourceResourceId.description: If createOption is Copy, this is the ARM id of the source snapshot or disk. If creationOption is Restore, this is the ARM-like id of the source disk restore point.

___storageAccountId.description: If createOption is Import, the Azure Resource Manager identifier of the storage account containing the blob to import as a disk. Required only if the blob is in a different subscription

___sourceUri.description: If creationOption is Import, this is a SAS URI to a blob to be imported into a managed disk. If creationOption is Copy, this is a relative Uri containing the id of the source snapshot to be copied into a managed disk.

___creationData.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

___accountType.description: the storage account type of the disk.

___diskSizeGB.description: If creationData.createOption is Empty, this field is mandatory and it indicates the size of the VHD to create. If this field is present for updates or creation with other options, it indicates a resize. Resizes are only allowed if the disk is not attached to a running VM, and can only increase the disk's size.

_88AdditionalUnattendContent.description: Additional XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. Contents are defined by setting name, component name, and the pass in which the content is a applied.

___passName.description: The pass name. Currently, the only allowable value is oobeSystem.

___componentName.description: The component name. Currently, the only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

___content.description: XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file in the specified pass and component. The XML must be less than 4 KB and must include the root element for the setting or feature that is being inserted.

___diskSizeGB.description: The initial disk size in GB for blank data disks, and the new desired size for existing OS and Data disks.

Describes a network profile.

___networkInterfaces.description: Specifies the list of resource IDs for the network interfaces associated with the virtual machine.

___licenseType.description: Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises. This element is only used for images that contain the Windows Server operating system.

$eref.description: Describes a diagnostics profile.

___bootDiagnostics.description: Boot Diagnostics is a debugging feature which allows the user to view console output and/or a screenshot of the virtual machine from the hypervisor.

___availabilitySet.description: The reference Id of the availability set to which the virtual machine belongs.

$eref.description: Describes a storage profile.
